title: Michael Sheen admits sleepless nights with newborn baby are 'overwhelming'
text:

Michael Sheen has revealed he is having "sleepless nights" with his newborn baby.

The Good Omens star's girlfriend, Anna Lundberg, gave birth to their beautiful daughter Lyra last month.

And Michael, 50, has admitted becoming a dad for the second time has been an "overwhelming" experience.

The Hollywood actor was speaking at the Pride Of Britain Awards - and confessed the inspirational night of heroes was one of the only things that would have got him out of the house.

He told Mirror Online: "There's not much that would have got me out on the night having just had a baby a few weeks ago but I didn't want to miss this."

(Image: Daily Mirror)

He added: "It's very, very special this awards. I was here last year as well and I was on the judging panel, which was incredible as you get to hear all the stories. Even the ones that don't win on the night."

Michael will be heading over to New York to film Fox series Prodigal Son, but is enjoying looking after his daughter.

When asked about baby Lyra, he told us: "All good. Sleepless nights and it's all a bit overwhelming but it's great."

(Image: Andy Stenning/Daily Mirror)

Michael shared an adorable snap of himself leaving the hospital while carrying his newborn daughter.

Announcing the news on social media, he wrote: "Happy to say that at 8:41am on Monday September 23rd our beautiful daughter Lyra was born.

"Thank you so much to Louise & all the brilliant midwives at both the Singleton and NeathPortTalbot hospitals."

Another tweet thanked fans for their well-wishes: "On behalf of Anna and myself thanks to everyone for your lovely messages of congratulations. It's been a wonderful, bleary-eyed week full of love and kindness and extraordinary poo. #NotReferringToMyself."

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Michael first confirmed he was expecting a child with 25 year-old Anna back in July - just two months after they were romantically linked.

He wrote at the time: "Very happy to let everyone know that my partner Anna and I are expecting a little angel of our own (Just to be clear, we're having baby!) #nottheantichrist."

The tweet was a reference to his recent project Good Omens, which sees his star as an angel alongside David Tennant's hellish demon.

It's not his first child, as he already shares 20 year-old Lily Mo Sheen with ex-girlfriend Kate Beckinsale.

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
